review_title: You can tell it was abandoned
one_reviews_text: New videos uploaded (slowly) but they don't have VR compatibility.
Worst app ever, I just want to watch VR-Videos and do not grap and put something somethere

review_title: Like the concept, but 360 is too blurry.
one_reviews_text: I like the general concept of the news room and all of the 360 experiences...but my main issue with anything 360 is the camera quality is so low that anything beyond 4 feet away is too blurry to bother watching. At that quality Id rather watch the same video on a 2D screen with HD. More of a technology/price restriction that prevents a VR App for news from being viable yet.

review_title: This is the sort of crap killing VR
one_reviews_text:
How can you make 3D one dimesional? 

by limiting UI's to this pathetic pesudo VR implemention of an obsolete technology.
great job
2D 360° Everywhere. This is not VR
App is good but they really need to update the stories more and perhaps have a live feed as well. Special events.. things like that. Kinda boring but has potential.

I like the format and the program runs well but there's too little news, a dozen clips at most. There are many more 360 degrees videos, some of which are very interesting but, understandably, there is not a lot rotation on them.  Twitter triggerring on the controls are nicely done but not always working.

Meh. It's a rather pedestrian fake news dashboard where you can select from a very limited asortment of low quality outdated 360 propaganda videos. There are no dates on the headlines. It's just some pretty much rando, recordings they were able to produce. It makes me want to design a REAL VR news experience. How about we all get together and build INFOWARS VR?

I've been trying to broaden my VR experiences past gaming, so this piqued my interest. A mainstream news company must have poured quite a bit of money into the development of a VR app right? Well, it definitely doesn't seem that way.

Whenever I launch this application, I'm placed into a pretty cool, sci-fi looking room. The Touch controllers have a nifty skin to go along with the aesthetics of the room. A hexagonal loading indicator loads in front of me, an exclamation point appears within it, and then...nothing.

That's literally it. An empty room with a loading indicator and then...a quest marker? An error message (with no text)? Who is to say. There's nothing beyond the exclamation mark. All of the Touch buttons do nothing besides the Oculus button taking me back out of the program.

 It's a cool, empty room if you'd like to be alone with your thoughts I guess, but I wanted something beyond that, like a VR news experience. Uninstalling.

The app is fine, albeit scrolling thourgh videos should be faster (more streamlined), you should be able to see titles in the list already. Form over function. ----

Content - yet another 360 flat video platform. It could have been part of YouTube content, at least interface there is much better (even if looking less flashy). ----

This offering is correctly working, but I expected cutting edge from CNN. Something on the level of quality that Felix&Paul offer. Too heavy for web streaming? Go 180 deg then... ---- 

Yeah, there's that news ticker. Much wow ;)
its all right needs a filter like the website and it be nice if the date was on them some of the clips seam old
Nice, the communist news network propaganda in VR glory.!

I really like where this is going. However, there needs to be better sorting, by date, by topics (sports, finance, politics, etc). The video quality is average, but like others have said there is no buffering. I don't have much interest in watching the news on a bigger screen. I'm more interested in the 360 videos, but the angles are horrible and the motion on some of them is going to make people sick. Why am I always 20 feet above ground? If it was more ground level, that would help.  Anyway, there are some very interesting stories and to be able to see some of these across the world sites and events in 360 degrees even if its not really VR is amazing. I hope this app improves, because we need more of this sort of thing.

review_title: Cool, exciting future but no killer app
one_reviews_text: It is exciting that CNN thinks enough of VR to make this app and to put recent news clips on here. And I haven't even seen one advertisement yet! So that's pretty awesome. However, I'm not sure that viewing this in VR is any better than just viewing online (other than the no ads thing). I have CNN on my Sling app, so I really don't need this. There are some 360 VR videos. They are cool. It just needs more of a reason to be in VR. I can't imagine anyone being in VR so much that they have to get their news clips from VR. Honestly, the headset is NOT that comfortable to be going to those lengths. And I play VR very often. But I try to save my time in VR for actual games or unique experiences that I can't get anywhere else. Still, it is nice that a major news corporation thinks enough of Oculus and VR users to make this.

Put your politics aside.  Install this app and get inspired on how the future of VR navigation (for non-games) should work.  Also, lots of great inspiration watching 360 videos (if you are a creator like me).  Amazingly great job CNN!

Easy access to interesting news stories - you can choose a sphere among others containing a news story and activate a video. Some stories are displayed on a big screen, others are 360 degrees videos. There are some older news stories among quite new stories - some just a few minutes old. Would be nice if it was possible to watch the CNN TV channel without having to actively choose subjects, but otherwise this app is my reference for watching news in VR. Works nicely using super-sampling 2.0 on a GTX 1080. Thank you, CNN!
I receive the message "user does not have entitlements for this app".  Anyone else have this problem?

Yeah, it's pretty simple, but it's a start I guess. They really need to reimagine what the news experience is, though.  I can watch CNN videos through any number of other apps, where I can also do other things.  So, CNN, why are people going to go to your VR app when the only thing it does is act like a 2D screening room with some 360 video?  You really need to offer something that people cannot get anywhere else.
I like the layout. interface and VR content but I get no audio on "flat" content.  Anyone else have this issue?  Tell me how to fix that and this goes to a 4!

As 360 video experiences go this isn't bad. Video quality is decent and there's some new content. The feature videos are 360 degree, but not VR, there is no 3d stereoscopic so the scale looks off. But it's not pixelated at least, and I experienced no buffering.
There are some latest clips as well, including the bridge collapse from this evening, that display on a big screen in front of you. As it's American, and I'm from the UK the content probably isn't interesting enough to get me  to laod it up again, but it's not bad, and if you like watching videos in VR (I don't) then you may get a lot out of it.

Nice, I like it but!

It would be nice to have Stereoscopic 180 videos as well. (Higher Quality video)
Usually I found my self thinking that the 360 Videos are blurry, they are....
Neat, can get all my communist propaganda beamed directly into my brain now.  We truly live in the future.

Never really considered I'd be using VR to check the news, but if you're going to partake in the news of the day, this is an interesting and immersive way to do it. The videos were really crytal clear which was suprising, but welcomed, and definitely increases my chances of daily visits.

review_title: CNN is the place for REAL NEWS!
one_reviews_text: Trump can suck-it and I'm sure he will once he's in prison.    Awesome app, love both the 360 videos and the flat news.  Works as expected.

review_title: no way to actually see video
one_reviews_text:
update. from one star to 4. today it just works. not that much of content. 360 video quality is what you would expect. 
old review:
so i grab a tile (grip button) and place the video tile on a globe.. when i release a button it snaps back to its original location. i tried place it on a globe + all button combinations - the same - just snaps back to its original location. So.. how do you actually play a video? btw tutorial only tells you " place tile on a globe" and waits for you to do that... no help there..
When browsing the menu there are no problems but when i try to open something it doesnt load

This app has a very good controll interface and the 2d Video is good BUT no way to controll the size of the video. The 360 video is also good BUT the videos i checked out for the most part needed better cam angles. Also please CNN put in Rewind fast forward and stop controlls just having pause and back is not good.
Doesn't open articles whether put "on the globe" or anywhere.  News subjects seem to be from only one category "Resist Trump".  Oh wait, it's CNN, I get it now.  That explains it.

What a beautifully designed app, very well done! The well crafted story library is interesting, fun and touching with a wide range of subjects from watching the beautiful solar eclipse to the grim images of family digging up their dead relatives from the rubble in Mosul. This is the new way of bringing people closer to the news. For me it is a great success already! My compliments to the developers. PS: I actually expected to see a virtual Wolf Blitzer in the introduction.
When I start CNN VR it says "User doesn't have entitlements for this application". Maybe it works in the US only? I'm in Australia
VR Console appears but when selecting a news item, black screen and nothing ever loads. News of the future ?!

review_title: Surprising, and Better than regular CNN!
one_reviews_text: I enjoyed the vignettes and found the immersion there despite being 360 video.

Great program.!  Works well, clean UI and excellent video quality.  Really like the Twitter page you can hold up and read.
Same issue.  Got the same error about the entitlements.   Canada here.  Seeem to work now :-)   I give a good 5 stars
This app is incredibly well done. The interface in specific is unlike any other, VR devs can definitely find some inspiration here.

review_title: Surround video rather than true VR
one_reviews_text: It's 360 video (and not great quality but at least I can stream it over my internet this way) not true VR. Despite this there's some interesting gems in there (from a stage view of Phantom of the opera, to seeing inside the Pyramids of Giza.) It's also free so worth a look.
Great!! I can't wait for all the news media to follow suit.

gimmicky, quickly thrown together app with some 360 and 2d videos. doesn't feel like fresh news at all. seems like something i would never use again. they also ripped off their main lobby design from racket nx. as if we don't all have that game. i am sure they won't support this pap very well or for very long. not enjoyable.
Interesting documentaries and 360 videos from around the world, amazing to experience places we can't go, and will improve as filming technology improves!
